He says, '..."neither do I condemn you...Go now and leave your life of sin"' (John 8:11 NIV). Jesus lifted her from a position of undeniable guilt to one of unconditional pardon. She didn't deserve it, and didn't know it was possible. And that's your story too, isn't it? We all mess up, and don't deserve God's love; but by His grace, we get it. How awesome is that!

content.title: Getting through family breakup
content.introtext:
When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned...

Isaiah 43:2 NIV
You may be in the middle of your parents' splitting up, and nothing feels worse than being stuck in the middle. It may feel like you're being torn in half. So, can you really 'walk through this fire' without being burned? The Bible says yes, but first you must: 1) Forgive yourself and your parents. Realise it's not your fault. You're not responsible for your parents' relationship, but it's easy to blame yourself. If you do feel responsible, read Isaiah 43:25. God forgives and forgets, and He'll give you the grace to forgive yourself, too. Forgiveness is the one power you always have over anybody who hurts you. So keep on forgiving your parents no matter what; every day. Only by forgiving will you be able to move on. 2) Take your time and stick with God. Don't expect it to all be sorted instantly. You've been hurt, and it will take time to heal. You may be on an emotional roller coaster, flitting between wanting them back together, and wanting them to suffer. Healthy people make healthy choices, so spend time reading God's Word, praying, asking advice, and letting God love you. '...your God is gracious and compassionate. He will not turn his face from you if you return to him' (2 Chronicles 30:9 NIV). It won't be easy, but realising God hasn't turned His back on you will help you through this.

content.title: Choose life!
content.introtext:
..."Do you want to be made well?"

John 5:6 NKJV
He hasn't walked for 38 years, the pool didn't have lifeguards to help, and there are no Stannah stair lifts like oldies have to help them up and down the stairs. So when Jesus rocks up and asks this dude '..."Do you want to be made well?"' it may seem like a bit of a 'well duuh' moment! But actually, He asked it to make the guy think. He obviously wanted to be well, but had he thought about what that would mean to his life; would he take responsibility for himself, look after others as well as himself, what job would he get to earn a living? When we ask God for stuff, we need to be prepared for His answer; it might come with an instruction to change. Sometimes, God's solution is a challenge to us. You're stuck for money? God says 'Ok, here's a paper round!'. He solves the problem, but we have to change too; you can't just sit on your butt and treat God like a free vending machine! The good news is, solving bigger problems brings bigger rewards. So ask God to stretch you today by helping you '...take up your bed and walk' (John 5:8 NKJV). Throw away that dependency and helplessness and move on to bigger and better things. Be prepared to do what God asks, and you'll see a change. Choose life; God's way.

content.title: Your new wardrobe
content.introtext:
...no one pours new wine into old wineskins.

Mark 2:22 NIV
Imagine it's your lucky day - you've been given £2000 to get yourself a whole new wardrobe. You jump on the bus and hit the shops, grabbing yourself some amazing outfits for every occasion. When you get home, the first thing you do is try everything on again, and do a little fashion show in front of the mirror. After a shopping trip like that, you proudly wear your new clothes everyday, showing the world just how mighty fine you look. You wouldn't get home, throw your clothes all over the floor, chuck food on them to cover them in stains, get out the scissors and cut a few holes in them, roll them about in some mud and get the dog to use them as his bed for a week, and only then would you put them on and wear them. If you did, that would be crazy, right? So if that's the case, why would you even think about doing that with your spiritual clothes? When you become a Christian, it's like God gives you that whole new-life-wardrobe. He gets rid of the old rough edges. So, don't go jumping straight into the old scabby clothes of your life before. Be proud of the changes in you, and show love instead of hate, humility instead of conceit, and worship of God instead of idolatry. Why bother with rags when God's given you riches?

content.title: Show your parents how it's done!
content.introtext:
...another generation arose after them who did not know the Lord...

Judges 2:10 NKJV
When Joshua was almost ready to pop his clogs, he called the nation's big bosses together for a bit of a business meeting. The leaders could remember being supernaturally fed for forty years, seeing the Red Sea sliced in two and the walls of Jericho crumbling. Knowing this, our mate Josh asks them who they're gonna serve. What's the response? 'Israel served the Lord all the days of Joshua...' (Joshua 24:31 NKJV). Sounds great so far! But it's not all as rosy as it looks. They served God partly, and only when it suited them. The one thing they had to do after Josh was dead and gone, was to hoover up the last pockets of pagan worship. But Israel '...did not drive out the inhabitants...' (Judges 1:27 NKJV). While Joshua had been fully committed to God, the others were only partly committed. So what were the consequences? Their kids messed up big time (Read how in Judges 2:10-19). What shaped the spiritual values of these children? The compromise of their parents! Parents don't always get it right; but unlike these guys here, you can get it right. You don't have to follow the path that everyone else around you is taking; instead, follow God's path, and do things His way. Flip it on its head and be an example to your parents, showing them that if you can live God's way, so can they.

content.title: Fame or faith?
content.introtext:
A good and honest life is a blessed memorial; a wicked life leaves a rotten stench.

Proverbs 10:7 TM
A cheerful thought for you today; one day, you'll die! When you do, what will people remember you for; fame, or faith? Barnabas isn't the most famous guy in the Bible, but he's called '...a good man...full of...faith...' (Acts 11:24 NIV) He wasn't a 'Paul', doing the kinds of things that made him stand out, and he's only mentioned three times in Acts: for selling his land to help finance God's works; vouching for Paul's character; and giving John Mark a second chance. Barnabas didn't earn much fame, but he was known for his faith! The Bible says: 'A good and honest life is blessed'; in God's eyes it's not what society considers important that counts, but faith. Check out the story of the rich man and Lazarus (Luke 16:19-31). For starters, we know Lazarus' name, but we don't have a clue who the rich man was? He may have been famous when he was alive, but where did that get him with God? Precisely nowhere! He had no faith on earth, and now he's only remembered as a nameless 'how not to do it' example! Lazarus may not have had the best life, or been known for anything special when he was alive, but his memory is much more blessed than the rich man's. So how will you be remembered when you're gone; for fame, or faith? Start living that good and honest faith-filled life today.

content.title: Who are ya?
content.introtext:
...I am fearfully and wonderfully made...

Psalm 139:14 NIV
Your true identity is found only in Jesus. Listen to whom the Bible says you are: You are 'a child of God' (John 1:12), You are 'Christ's friend' (John 15:15) You are 'a new creation' (2 Corinthians 5:17) You are 'God's workmanship - His handiwork - born anew in Christ to do His work' (Ephesians 2:10) You are 'a saint' ( Ephesians 1:1) You are 'righteous and holy' (Ephesians 4:24) You are 'a citizen of Heaven' (Philippians 3:20 ) You are 'hidden with Christ in God' (Colossians 3:3) You are an 'expression of the life of Christ because He is your life' (Colossians 3:4) You are 'chosen of God, holy and dearly loved' (Colossians 3:12) You are a 'child of light and not of darkness' (1Thessalonians 5:5) You are a 'member of a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for God's own possession' (1 Peter 2:9-10) You are an 'alien and stranger to this world in which you temporarily live' (1 Peter 2;11) You are an 'enemy of the devil' (1Peter 5:8) You are a 'child of God and you will resemble Jesus when He returns' (1 John 3:1-2) You are 'born of God - and the evil one cannot touch you' (1 John 5:18) You are 'fearfully and wonderfully made' and that's just the start! Know your worth, know your value. It's found in Jesus.

content.title: What are you doing that for?
content.introtext:
When you ask, you do not receive, because you ask with wrong motives, that you may spend what you get on your pleasures.

James 4:3 NIV
'What am I doing this for?' It's a good question to ask yourself often; especially when you're praying! Sometimes we can seem to be doing something good and right but the reason behind what we're doing is all wrong. You might look good making a cup of tea for your dad and buying him his favourite chocolate bar, but if you're doing this because you've just had your mobile phone bill and want him to pay for it; then your reason for being kind is all wrong. The Bible says in 1 Samuel 16:7 'People judge by outward appearance, but the Lord looks at the heart'. You might be able to fool people that you are doing things because you are such a lovely person, but you can't fool God; He looks right through you and sees the reasons behind your actions. Always check your reason for praying is a good one not a selfish one. Why are you praying for this person or situation? Is it just to make your life easier? God wants our reason for doing things to be because we love Him and because we love people. Being selfish, revengeful or manipulative, will get you nowhere with God. In fact He says if we ask Him for good stuff but our motive is wrong, then forget it. He's not interested, we won't get it! So, why are you doing that?

content.title: Get Real!
content.introtext:
And how bold and free we then become in his presence, freely asking according to his will, sure that he's listening.

1 John 5:14 TM
You know it would be pointless to keep asking the school's Head Teacher to let you play sports or computer games all day, don't you? You know it would be pointless to walk into a bank and ask them to give you as much money as you wanted whenever you wanted it, don't you? Why? Because these things will never happen will they? If the teacher and the bank manager agreed to your request they wouldn't be doing their job properly would they? Be careful you don't keep asking God for pointless things! Just like the teacher and the bank manager, God has got a plan of how best to do things. And get this; He knows what's best! So if you come along with a stupid request like, 'make me invisible so I can go and spy on everyone in school', you should know its not going to happen! And that's not because God isn't listening or doesn't care. It's because you are asking Him to go against what He knows is right and He will never do that! Even if your reason for wanting to be invisible is valid; like you want to find out what the school bullies are planning, so you can stop it before it happens; God won't do it! So get real! Tap into God's agenda and know with confidence He is listening and will act!

content.title: Tell all
content.introtext:
If I had cherished sin in my heart, the Lord would not have listened.

Psalm 66:18 NIV
Have you seen that programme 'How Clean Is Your House'? If you have you may have found yourself screaming at the TV, 'Uggh!! How can they live like that?' as you look in horror at the amount of dirt and rubbish that's inside. Thankfully by the end of the programme you're feeling relieved, as the house is how it should be; nice and clean! But it only got clean because those brave souls asked for help. They decided that it was better to deal with the humiliation of having their dirty houses shown on TV than for them to live that way any way longer. And even though they are named and shamed in front of thousands watching, by the end of the programme they are looking happy, relieved. Their houses look completely different and their lives have changed for the better. When we do things wrong and go against God, it's like we are messing our lives up as much as those people messed up their houses. If we don't ask for help it stays there. Our lives get messier and messier, dirtier and smellier. Carrying this around all day can make us feel, ashamed, guilty, angry, unloved, useless, hopeless, all negative feelings. That's why God says, 'Talk to Me, tell Me all about it; ask for My help, My love, My forgiveness. Just ask and it's yours'. Hide nothing, tell God everything and keep clean!

content.title: To boldly go...
content.introtext:
...approach the throne of grace with confidence, so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our time of need.

Hebrews 4:16 NIV
To boldly go where no man has gone before! Recognise the phrase from Star Trek? The space ship, reaching places that had never been seen before! Of course it's just SciFi fantasy; we've not mastered travelling through space in that way just yet! But because of Jesus we are all able to boldly go where no man or woman could go before; directly to God. Before Jesus came to earth not everyone was able to talk directly to God. Animal sacrifices had to be made and certain people were chosen, priests, to go into a place in the centre of the temple and talk to God on behalf of all the people. Often they would tie a long rope around one ankle, so they could be dragged out in case they died in there! Can you imagine having to pray like that? Those guys didn't walk in there with confidence to enjoy Gods' company. They went in scared stiff wondering if they'd be coming out alive! Crazy huh? But because God loves us so much, He chose to send His only Son, Jesus, to the earth, to die the ultimate sacrifice, so through believing in Jesus, we can talk with God whenever we want to, we can be forever with God (John 3:16) It's amazingly fantastic! Go confidently, boldly, to God; He's waiting.

He will call upon me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble, I will deliver him and honor him.

Psalm 91:15 NIV
A child picks up the phone and dials 999 and asks 'is Santa there?' Why? Because he had been annoying his Mum!. Did you know that every day people call 999 when they shouldn't. Calls that say 'I've stubbed my toe' 'There's a dead cat in the road' 'I've lost my keys' 'there's a spider in my bath' 'There's a rat in my kitchen' 'I've ran out of credit!' sound funny at first. But when you see posters about town saying 'Call an ambulance for the wrong reason and someone might die' and you realize the seriousness of the situation. What's so great about God is that He can always cope with the amount of emergency calls He gets. He doesn't even mind if they're trivial or not. He just wants you to call. He wants you to know He's always there to help you. Whatever is bothering you bothers Him. You are so important to Him, you matter so much. '"If you'll hold on to me for dear life,"' says God, '"I'll get you out of any trouble. I'll give you the best of care if you'll only get to know and trust me. Call me and I'll answer, be at your side in bad times; I'll rescue you, then throw you a party. I'll give you a long life; give you a long drink of salvation!"'(Psalm 91:14 TM).

content.title: Street wise
content.introtext:
Fools are headstrong and do what they like; wise people take advice

Proverbs 12:15 TM
There was a girl on Channel 4's Big Brother called Alex, who believed she was always right and everyone around her was wrong. She never seemed to listen properly to what other people were saying, but shouted at people to listen to her. 'Just remember I told you' she said several times during an argument with a fellow housemate one day. But it was as if no-one could tell her anything. Several times Alex was called to the diary room, where it was explained to her that her behaviour was unacceptable, but she continued acting in the same unacceptable way and it wasn't long before she was removed from the BB house. What if Alex had listened to what was being said to her by BB, would it have made a difference to her, do you think? Would she have been removed from the house if not only had she listened but acted upon the advice given to her by BB? God says 'Fools think their own way is right, but the wise listen to others'. Sometimes we get things wrong. Sometimes its easier for people around us to see where we are going wrong than it is to see it ourselves. What's the word on the streets? Listen to what is being said about you. Listen to what God has to say about it. Is it time for you to change? Be wise; Street wise!

content.title: God knows best.
content.introtext:
Trust God from the bottom of your heart; don't try to figure out everything on your own

Proverbs 3:5 TM
'I told you so! I knew it! I'm right!' We all enjoy saying words like that don't we? We all want to be right and hate being wrong. But we need to get used to being wrong if we want to live the Christian life. 1 Corinthians 1:25 says: 'For the foolishness of God is wiser than man's wisdom...' That means that even the cleverest thing we could ever say sounds so not clever to God. A guy in the Bible called Job, had to go through some really rotten stuff in his life and one day he was moaning on to God about it and asked God if He really knew what He was doing? Job thought he was being clever! But God put him in his place saying things like, 'Right Job, did you put the stars in place? No, you didn't! So until you can do stuff like that, don't even think about questioning me, because I obviously know well more than you. Just trust me!' (for the full version of this chat, read the last few chapters of the book of Job). It shut Job up good and proper. How can you possibly answer that? Well that's just the thing...you can't...no-one can. We were never meant to figure everything out by ourselves, we were meant to ask God and learn from Him. So go on ask...and keep asking. He'll tell you everything you need to know.

content.title: 'I AM' Confident
content.introtext:
Now faith is being sure of what we hope for and certain of what we do not see

Hebrews 11:1 NIV
Seven times in the Gospel of John Jesus describes himself as 'I AM...'. I AM: bread, light, gate, good shepherd, the resurrection and the life, the way, truth and life, and the true vine. He never said 'I might be', 'I could be' or 'I wanna be'. He said 'I AM'. He was definite, positive, confident, absolutely sure whom He was. Every time He said 'I AM' He told us an amazing truth about himself. Chew over these: 1) '..."I am the bread of life. He who comes to me will never be hungry again..."' (John 6:35 NIV) 2) '..."I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life"' (John 8:12 NIV) 3) '"I am the gate; whoever enters through me will be saved"' (John 10:9 NIV) 4) '"I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep."' (John 10:11 NIV) 5) '..."I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in me will live, even though he dies"' (John 11:25 NIV) 6) '"I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me"' (John 14:6 NIV) 7) '"I am the true vine, and my Father is the gardener"' (John 15:1 NIV) Today be confident in the faith you have in Jesus. Be confident in I AM - I AM CONFIDENT!

content.title: It's not fair! Is it?
content.introtext:
Now faith is being sure of what we hope for and certain of what we do not see

Hebrews 11:1 NIV
Ever felt disappointed? It's not a nice feeling is it? It's that feeling you get when things just don't turn out like you'd hoped they would. It stinks! Life feels so unfair doesn't it? Ever felt disappointed in God? Sometimes, when we hear what God has done for other people, we can hope that God will do the same for us. We begin to put our faith in God to do these things for us. We may want God to make us into a fantastic worship leader or preacher or help us get that job, or get that girl/guy to go out with us, just like He did for those other people. Or maybe we want God to do amazing miracles through us like we read about in books. 'If God has done it for them' you say, 'then I believe God will do it for me. I have faith!' But sometimes that thing we hoped for doesn't happen and we can get really disappointed. :( [KMP1] If this has happened to you, ask yourself this, 'Did I hear God promise to do that for me, or did I just tell God I wanted it?' Remember what you read yesterday? The first part of faith is listening. What God promises to one person he may not promise to you. Listen to what God is saying to you and put your faith in that; He won't disappoint you!

content.title: LBA?
content.introtext:
Now faith is being sure of what we hope for and certain of what we do not see.

Hebrews 11:1 NIV
Did you see this years' blockbuster movie, Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull? If you're a fan you will have no doubt seen one of the earlier films, Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade. In this film Indy sets out to find the treasure with the help of his father. Along the path Indy reaches what looks to be a massive canyon, a sheer drop, making it impossible to get to the other side. Indy trusts his father's words, figures out the clues, takes a leap of faith and finds his feet are safely on solid rock. Indy doesn't fall to his death! There was a bridge there all the time, he just couldn't see it. Only when he steps out does he find it. If Indy had only believed in what he could see at that moment he would never have reached the treasure. It took faith. He needed to trust his father's words and walk on the bridge, even though he couldn't see it. Very scary! We need to have faith in God. Faith is spelt: LBA; Listening to what God says, Believing it's true and finally Acting on it. Faith is living our lives by what we believe to be true about God; even if it doesn't seem to make sense. Its about believing God is right and trusting him to do what He says, and guess what? He is and He will!

content.title: Consult God!
content.introtext:
A man's heart plans his way, But the LORD directs his steps...

Proverbs 16:9 NKJV
George dreamed of joining the Navy, but his mother, who was a widow raising her children alone, didn't like the idea. Nevertheless she put on a brave face and agreed to let him go. The day he was due to sail he hugged her good-bye but to everyone's surprise she started to cry. After going through so much heartbreak she just couldn't take any more. George must not board that ship; instead he must stay and be strong for the rest of the family. The boy in the midshipman's uniform wanted a Navy career, but not if it meant adding to his mother's grief. So reluctantly he returned his uniform and ordered his belongings ashore. Of all the young men who might have left home in search of adventure and didn't, he was just one more. Yet his decision had profound influence on the Revolutionary War. A mother's upset stopped her fifteen-year-old from ascending the ranks of the British Navy and embarking on an adventure very different from the one for which he eventually became famous. That's because the boy's name was George Washington, first president of the United States of America. 'We make...plans, but the Lord decides where we will go.' 'The...steps we take come from God; otherwise how would we know where we're going?' (Proverbs 20:24 TM). God knows where he wants you, so don't be afraid if your plans don't quite work out! [KMP1]This seems a little one-sided! [k2]Delete this - it is a fictional tale, not a true story

content.title: Your faith gets God's attention
content.introtext:
...your faith has healed you.

Luke 8:48 NIV
Read Luke 8:43-48. In this story a woman who'd been bleeding for 12 years crept through a crowd to touch the edge of Jesus cloak. After she was instantly healed, Jesus knew something had happened because He 'felt the power go out of Him'. The woman confessed it was her and Jesus blessed her. Notice three important things in this story: 1) She did something she'd never done before. She decided to try Jesus. Smart move! Faith means stepping into the unknown and taking a risk you've never taken before. 2) She recognised her moment. She knew that Jesus was visiting her town, and might not be back. There are 'God-moments' in life when you've got to get over your fear and move out in faith. If you don't, you'll miss them. 3) She started a new thing. Until then no one had been healed by touching His cloak but her act of faith was a new day. 'People brought all their sick to him and begged him to let the sick just touch the edge of his cloak, and all who touched him were healed' (Matthew 14:35-36 NIV). God is looking for people who are willing to break with tradition. When He finds them, He uses them to open doors and show new ways of how He can work. So don't be scared to step out and take a risk, it might just start a new thing!

content.title: I don't want to be a Christian! (2)
content.introtext:
Selling their possessions and goods they gave to anyone as he had need.

Acts 2:45 NIV
The Bible says that God wants to bless us. There's an understanding amongst lots of Christians that says God's blessing means if we give £10 we'll get back £100; but it's interesting that nowhere in the whole Bible is this the case! In fact, if you read about the start of the church in Acts you'll see just the opposite. Back then, anyone who had ANYTHING they didn't need, whether it was a building, a camel or a PS2(!) sold it. They then put all the money into a big pot and gave it to the poor. That way no one had too much but everyone had enough, they simply shared what God had given them. How amazing is that? Of course as Christians we all read our Bible and think 'ahh, that's really great. Maybe I should put an extra £10 in the offering this week'. But maybe as followers of Jesus, it's time for an ebay revolution! After all, why is it we pick and choose what bits of the Bible we like and ignore the rest (telling ourselves that bit's not relevant for today)? Maybe as Christians we spend too much time trying to interpret the Bible to make it fit with what we want it to say. After all, Jesus never owned a thing. So why does the stack of DVDs in the corner keep getting higher?

content.title: I don't want to be a Christian! (1)
content.introtext:
I have been crucified with Christ..

Galatians 2:20 NIV
When you became a Christian, did you really look at the label and read the small print? Did you think through what you were buying into? Our churches and youth groups are full of 'Christians', but how many of them can really be called 'followers of Christ'? It's all too easy to miss-sell Christianity as a free ticket to heaven and cushy life with ready-made mates. But this is not what it means to be a true follower of Jesus. Paul writes: 'I am crucified with Christ.' To our selfish lives those words are about as appealing as having a tooth out; yet that's exactly what we're supposed to be as Christians! In theory we should have laid down our own lives, given up our plans, our relationships, our gifts, our possessions; put them before Jesus and said 'You have them, I'll do whatever You want me to do'. But how many of us have really done this? We can all probably remember the odd moment in an incredible time of worship and intimacy with Jesus when we gently whispered 'You can have it all'. But the sad truth is most of us walk out of that place and within 24 hours we've picked everything back up again for ourselves and carried on as normal. Think today, do I want to be a Christian; or a follower of Jesus?

content.title: Taking personal responsibility (2)
content.introtext:
Each one should use whatever gift he has received to serve others...

1 Peter 4:10 NIV
When someone tells you to be more 'responsible', it's usually the last thing you'd ever want to do. After all, isn't that for people who are old and boring, and people who never have any fun? In fact the opposite is true; as you grow up the more responsible you are the more freedom you're going to have to have fun, because things are far less likely to go 'Pete Tong'! It's not about being old or boring or mature, it's about realising you're responsible for your own life and making good choices instead of doing something stupid and regretting it for the rest of your life. Here are three ways in which we can be more responsible. 1) Following through. If you're a quitter; someone who never finishes what they start, try giving yourself smaller things to finish. Do stuff that really matters to you, and when you start to finish those, think about tackling some other areas. 2) Taking care of the small stuff. How often do you forget small things; that are big things to others? Like forgetting anniversaries and birthdays, not taking the bins out or not calling someone back. Start sorting out the small things first, they matter to other people! 3) Do it yourself. Too many people expect others to do things for them, especially if you're used to your parents doing things. So start doing things by yourself!

content.title: Taking personal responsibility (1)
content.introtext:
If you are wise, your wisdom will reward you...

Proverbs 9:12 NIV
We all love the idea of a better world, city or school. Maybe you've even been praying for God to DO SOMETHING, what if he has done something - sent you! In a graduation speech he was giving to a whole load of uni students, Chief Judge Alexander Saunders said, 'As responsibility is passed to your hands it will not do to assume that someone else will bear the major burdens, that someone else will demonstrate the key convictions, that someone else will be elected Member of Parliament, take care of the poor, visit the sick, protect civil rights, enforce the law, transmit value, and defend freedom. What you do not value will not be valued, what you do not remember will not be remembered, what you do not change will not be changed, what you do not do will not be done. You can, if you will, craft a society whose leaders...are less obsessed with the need for money. It's not a question of what to do, but simply the will to do it.' Paul writes: '...each one should carry his own load' (Galatians 6:5 NIV). Don't leave it to someone else! You've got a job to do! Sometimes we don't take responsibility because we believe others are more qualified. No, people who make a difference in life, only do so because they decided to try. Plus: God doesn't call the qualified, He qualifies the called!

content.title: Go 'a little farther'
content.introtext:
He went a little farther...and prayed...

Mark 14:35 NKJV
Throughout history God has looked for men and women to passionately pray on behalf of a lost world. More often than not, He's been disappointed. '...I sought for a man...who would...stand in the gap before Me on behalf of the land, that I should not destroy it; but I found no one' (Ezekiel 22:30 NKJV). The disciples were willing to go with Jesus into the garden of Gethsemane but they didn't get how important it was to pray that night and all fell asleep. Even Peter, James and John, the guys in the inner circle, didn't 'get it,' so in the end Jesus went 'a little farther' and prayed alone. Prayer can be a lonely business and you have to stick at it. You can go for months and years before seeing some of the changes that you've prayed so hard about. On the other hand, when you go deeper with God, you get to share things that the disciples missed and only angels got to see to that night in the garden. Why not get your youth group to set up a 24/7 prayer room for a week, or turn your bedroom into your own garden of Gethsemane and give up some sleep to go deeper with God? You could even join the grannies at your church for the early morning prayer meeting! How about it, is God calling you to go 'a little farther?'

content.title: Dead sticks don't flower - do they?
content.introtext:
...the rod of Aaron...sprouted and...produced blossoms...

Numbers 17:8 NKJV
New leadership was urgently needed in Israel. So God ordered an elder from each of the twelve tribes to bring a wooden staff with his name on it, and leave it overnight in the tabernacle - the big tent that they used as a portable temple. He said, 'the staff belonging to the man I choose will sprout...' (Numbers 17:5 NIV). Next morning Aaron's rod 'sprouted and...produced blossoms.' Notice: 1) Whose staff grew blossom; Aaron's! Obviously God doesn't pick His leaders because they're perfect. Aaron's CV included making a golden calf for Israel to worship, then defending himself by saying, 'That cow just walked out of the fire all by itself.' Would you pick somebody like that? God did. That's because He sees in us potential qualities He can use to fulfil His purposes. Keep that in mind, next time a leader disappoints you. And remember it, should God call you to lead. 2) Where it blossomed; in the presence of the Lord. Certain things only happen in God's presence. In Aaron's case a walking stick came to life in '...the tabernacle of meeting...where I meet with you' (Numbers 17:4 NKJV). So, sort out your priorities, set time to meet with God each day, and keep it. 3) When it blossomed; during the darkness. Remember your faith grows when you are going through hard and dark times rather than when everything is cool.

content.title: The ultimate self-esteem!
content.introtext:
...perfect love casts out fear...

1 John 4:18 NKJV
What are you afraid of? 'There is no room in love for fear. Well-formed love banishes fear. Since fear is crippling, a fearful life-fear of death, fear of judgment-is one not yet fully formed in love.' (1 John 4:18 TM). Today, ask God to give you a fresh understanding of how much He loves you, for who He loves He prizes, protects, and provides for. Paul writes: '...[I pray]...that...you'll be able to take in...the extravagant dimensions of Christ's love...' (Ephesians 3:18 TM). Extravagant love! God's Love is MASSIVE, He couldn't love you any more than He does right now! You say, 'What does God's love look like?' Look at the cross. If you had been the only person who ever lived, Jesus would have died just for you. Even if you're thinking 'yeah but you don't know how I've messed up' He never stops loving you! You didn't do anything to deserve it, so when you fail you don't lose it. The Bible says: '...absolutely nothing can get between us and God's love...' (Romans 8:39 TM). Don't even be afraid of your weaknesses. As you get your head round it and you're more secure in God's love you can begin to acknowledge your weaknesses, seek His help, grow strong, and use the gifts He's given you. When you know God loves you, not despite but because of who you are, you have the ultimate self-esteem; and it comes from God's esteem for you.

content.title: Why bother with church!
content.introtext:
...Let us go into the house of the Lord.

Psalm 122:1 NIV
What's your reason for not going to church? Before you answer, read Ten Reasons Why I Never Wash! 1) I was forced to wash as a child 2) people who wash are all hypocrites; they think they are cleaner than everyone else 3) there are so many different kinds of soap; I just can't decide which one is best for me 4) I used to wash, but I got bored and stopped doing it 5) I only wash on special occasions like Christmas and Easter 6) none of my friends wash 7) I'll start washing when I get older and dirtier 8) I don't have time to wash 9) the bathroom is never warm enough in winter or cool enough in summer 10) the people who make soap are only after your money! Sound familiar? Watchman Nee, who went to prison for going to church in China says, 'Alone I cannot serve the Lord effectively, and he will spare no pains to teach me this. He will bring things to an end, allowing doors to close and leaving me effectively knocking my head against a wall until I realise that I need the help of the body, as well as of the Lord.' We need church; you'll find a spiritual family to belong to, a faith to live by, and a focus that gets your eyes where they should be; on Jesus!

content.title: Let God heal your wounds!
content.introtext:
...I will...heal your wounds...

Jeremiah 30:17 NIV
Addressing students at Virginia Tech after a shooting rampage that left 32 of their fellow students dead, Philip Yancey said: 'You've heard, "Things will get better, you'll get past this." Those who offer such comfort mean well, and what you feel now you won't always feel...Yet you're a different person because of that day. When three of my friends died I came across these lines: "Grief melts away like snow in May,"... It did melt away, but like snow it came back in fierce, unexpected ways, triggered by a sound, a smell, a fragment of memory.' Yancey, who was recovering at the time from a car crash continued, 'Pain is a sign of life and love. I'm wearing a neck brace because I broke my neck in an accident. The doctor kept asking, "Does this hurt? Can you feel that?" The answer he desperately wanted was, "Yes, it hurts, I can feel it"; proof that my spinal cord hadn't been severed. Pain offers proof of life, of connection. In deep wounds two kinds of tissue must heal: connective tissue, plus the outer protective tissue. If the outer protective tissue heals too quickly the inner connective tissue won't heal properly, leading to complications later.' Real healing takes time; it takes place where God's presence, God's peace, and God's people are. Are you hurting today? Turn to God. His promise to you is 'I will...heal your wounds.'

content.title: A love letter from Jesus (3)
content.introtext:
You...are a letter from Christ.

2 Corinthians 3:3 NIV
'...if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation; the old has gone, the new has come!' (2 Corinthians 5:17 NIV). The message in our letter should make it clear that we're not the people we used to be, because: 1) Christ has changed us mentally. Being '...transformed by the renewing of [our] mind' (Romans 12:2 NIV) we now look at life, ourselves, others, our challenges and options in light of God's thoughts, not ours. We see opportunities where we saw only obstacles, and possibilities where we saw only problems. Minds that were frazzled with worry, are now filled with confidence and peace. 2) Christ has changed us morally. 1 Corinthians 6:9-10 describes how NOT to live-It describes 'those who use and abuse each other, use and abuse sex, use and abuse the earth and everything in it' and then we're hit with verse 11: 'for not so long ago you were on that list. Since then, you've been cleaned up and given a fresh start by Jesus' (TM). He has transformed our character. 3) Christ has changed us spiritually. That's why only someone who has God's Spirit can understand spiritual blessings. Anyone who doesn't have God's Spirit thinks these blessings are foolish (1 Corinthians 2:14)! Your letter should read: 'Jesus changed my life, and if you let Him, He will change yours too!' So, today, deliver your love letter to everyone you meet.

content.title: A love letter from Jesus (2)
content.introtext:
You...are a letter from Christ.

2 Corinthians 3:3 NIV
The Bible says your life is a love letter from Jesus, 'known and read by everybody.' But a letter is only effective, if it is easily read and understood. Adults moan because they can't understand text language, 'what's "C U L8R M8" mean?' They don't get it; which isn't a problem when you txt your mate but might cause difficulties when you txt your mum! People must understand your message. How can you make sure your love letter from Jesus gets through to the people He's sending it to? Here are things that some common things can confuse your message: a) a begrudging, resentful attitude when a friend, teacher, or parent asks you to go the extra mile and help at an inconvenient time b) not giving your best to the things you've committed to c) being unreliable, not keeping promises d) touchiness, like when you wear your feelings on your sleeve, are easily upset and overreact to unintended offences e) temper tantrums or sulking, where you're moody and grumpy because things don't go your way f) compromising, where you go with the flow and don't take a stand or have the guts to stand out. Instead of Jesus they see moody or unreliable or compromising Christians. How we live says something; we can give people the wrong message. Jesus has a letter of love. Make sure people can get it.

content.title: A love letter from Jesus (1)
content.introtext:
You...are a letter from Christ...

2 Corinthians 3:3 NIV
'This is how much God loved the world: He gave his Son, his one and only Son...by believing in him, anyone can have a whole and lasting life' (John 3:16) God sent Jesus to demonstrate His love and He sends us to tell people 'You...are a letter from Christ...written not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God.' When a letter arrives two questions immediately spring up in our mind: 1) Who is it for? John's answer is 'ANYONE'! For every person you meet, you will have something they need. Friends, enemies, relatives, neighbours and strangers need the message you have and the hope you bring. 2) Who is it from? A letter from someone you fancy is more interesting than some junk mail! Remember, you are a letter from Christ, about Christ. 'For we do not preach ourselves, but Jesus Christ as Lord...' (2 Corinthians 4:5 NIV). Our message is not about us; it's about Jesus. 'But are people really interested in Jesus?' you ask. In His lifetime Jesus was a national celebrity who could draw big crowds. Statistics say 1 billion people across the world are Christians today. Jesus isn't junk mail. 'But I, when I am lifted up...will draw all men to myself' (John 12:32 NIV). Today nothing is more needed than a living portrait of Jesus Christ, so deliver your love letter to 'anyone' who crosses your path!

content.title: The Interpreter
content.introtext:
We do not know what we ought to pray for, but the Spirit himself intercedes for us...

Romans 8:26 NIV
When you go to a foreign country you can feel uncomfortable and a bit lost, because you don't speak the language. The language of the spiritual world is prayer and since the spiritual world is the source of our power; victory, peace, joy, and everything else we need; it's essential that we learn to speak it. The good news is, we have the perfect teacher and interpreter; the Holy Spirit Himself. One of His jobs is to teach us the language of prayer and guide us when it comes to addressing God and He's good at this job! The Bible says the Holy Spirit can interpret our prayers to God even when we don't know what to say. 'If we don't know how or what to pray, it doesn't matter. He does our praying in and for us, making prayer out of our wordless sighs, our aching groans' (Romans 8:26 TM). Isn't that cool? Prayer is the link between the physical and the spiritual world; remember Jesus listened to His Dad. He looked into heaven and copied it on earth. The Spirit also shows us what God is saying. That's why prayer cannot be rushed. It's also why taking time to be still before God is so important. It allows the Holy Spirit to share God's thoughts with us, so that we begin thinking His way and be like Him on earth?

content.title: Allow God to shape you
content.introtext:
...we are the clay, and You our potter...

Isaiah 64:8 NKJV
Imagine a beautiful china teacup saying: 'I wasn't always like this. There was a time when I was just a cold, hard lump of clay. One day the potter picked me up and said, "I could do something with this." Then he started to put pressure on me and change my shape. I said, "What are you doing? That hurts. Stop!" But he said, "Not yet." Then he put me on a wheel and began to spin me around and around until I shouted, "Let me off." He replied, "Not yet." Then he shaped me into a cup and put me in a hot oven. I cried, "Let me out of here, I'm suffocating." But he looked at me and said, "Not yet." When he took me out, I thought his work on me was over, but then he started to paint me, then I was back in the oven, it was so hot! Then I he put me on shelf till I thought he'd forgotten me. Eventually I saw what had happened; I had become a beautiful teacup' There are things going on in your life today that you don't understand. When you finally get to the place God wants you to be, you'll realise that He has been making you into a vessel He can use, bless, and use to bless others. So, allow God to shape you!

content.title: CARRY EACH OTHER'S BURDENS
content.introtext:
"CARRY EACH OTHER'S BURDENS..."

GALATIANS 6:2 NIV
The Bible says we're a body with different parts doing different jobs. Instead of gazing at our own belly-buttons we should be looking at how we can help each other, just like the soldier in this story... 'I noticed a guy out of sync. A big, raw-boned redhead named Sanderson. His legs were pumping but he was out of step with the rest of us. His head began to loll from side to side. He was close to losing it. Without missing a step the ranger on Sanderson's right reached over and took his rifle. Now one of the rangers was packing two weapons. The big redhead did better for a time. But then, while the platoon kept moving, his jaw became slack, his eyes glazed and his legs pushed like pistons. Soon his head began to sway again. This time the ranger on the left reached over, removed Sanderson's helmet, tucked it under his own arm and continued to run. Our boots thudded along the dirt trail in heavy unison. Thud, thud, thud! But Sanderson was hurting ; really hurting. He was buckling, going down. But no, two soldiers behind him lifted the pack off his back, each taking a shoulder strap in his free hand. Sanderson gathered his remaining strength, squared his shoulders and the platoon continued to run; all the way to the finish line.' Whose load can you help to carry today?

content.title: GOT ENOUGH CREDIT???
content.introtext:
..."ABRAHAM BELIEVED GOD, AND IT WAS CREDITED TO HIM..."

JAMES 2:23 NIV
Old Abe; He lived about 4000 years ago and was pretty comfy with his well-to-do family in a big buzzing city. One day he heard God calling him to pack his tent and sleeping bag and head off somewhere new. Cool! Except God didn't say where! But Abraham wasn't thick, he knew that searching for God's 'somewhere' was better than settling for the world's 'anywhere'. Abraham is an example of faith at its finest. The Bible calls believing what God says 'FAITH' and says Abraham's faith was so great that ;it was credited to him'. Just like you need credit to make your mobile phone work, God accepted Abraham's faith as credit to make his life work. Are you feeling today as if your life is low on credit? Have you started accepting the world's 'anywhere' rather than God's 'somewhere'? Choose to believe God and take the example of Abe; his faith had to stand many tests: a) when he left his family and country, he didn't have a clue where God was taking him b) he wasn't a real hard nut but he fought the enemy to save his family c) he believed for a son, even when he and his wife were well too old for all that making babies stuff! So keep believing God and don't run out of credit.

content.title: Ransomed, redeemed, rescued!
content.introtext:
He provided redemption for his people...

Psalm 111:9 NIV
You've seen it in the movies; the kidnappers trap the billionaire's son, and send a ransom note: 'give us 10 million or never see your son again'. The word redeemed, which gets used in church in songs and stuff means this: TO BUY BACK. If the billionaire paid up, he has redeemed his child. He has paid the price to get back what was his in the first place. In the movies the hero normally crashes through a window and rescues the kid, but the in the Bible the hero is also the redeemer. The hero pays the price to get us back to God. Have you ever thought of yourself as somebody who needs to be redeemed or bought back? The Bible says our selfishness and sin caused us to fall into '...the trap of the devil...held captive to do his will' (2 Timothy 2:26 NIV). Getting back to God, your rightful owner, could only come through redemption and that's exactly what God did! 'For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life' (John 3:16 NIV). Christ's death on the cross was the price of your redemption, your ransom; that's how much God values you! A Christian simply is someone knows they needed rescuing. If you've never asked God to rescue you, you can do it today; what's stopping you?

content.title: Make that your attitude, too!
content.introtext:
...Think on these things.

Philippians 4:8 KJV
Your ability to succeed in life often comes down to a single choice: how you react to what has been done to you in the past, or is being done to you right now. Dr Viktor Frankl endured the Holocaust by this principle. The Nazis killed his family, placed him in a concentration camp, starved and beat him. When the war ended Frankl was neither broken nor bitter. When asked how he endured such treatment with a positive outlook he said, 'Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of human freedoms, to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose one's own way.' Listen to the attitude God's Word calls us to adopt: 'I'd say you'll do best by filling your minds and meditating on things true, noble, reputable, authentic, compelling, gracious; the best, not the worst; the beautiful, not the ugly; things to praise, not things to curse' (Philippians 4:8) Every day you choose the clothes you wear, the food you eat, and the attitude you adopt. And there are only two kinds of attitudes; good ones and bad ones. A good attitude is the one the Psalmist adopted when he woke up each morning: 'This is the day the Lord has made; we will rejoice and be glad in it' (Psalms 118:24 NKJV). Make that your attitude too!

content.title: Serve, don't strive!
content.introtext:
...Jesus...made Himself nothing...

Philippians 2:5-7 NIV
The story is told of an ambitious student at a top notch uni. Just before entering his final year he met an old hippy who said, 'Your idea of happiness is to work around the clock, to study so you can get a better grade than the next guy. That's not how you're supposed to live. Come discover peace, man.' Before you know it the student had called his parents and told them he was dropping out of uni to live in a hippy commune. Six months later they received a letter: 'Dear Mum and Dad, I know you were upset about my decision. But I've changed! I have peace. Here there's no competing, no trying to get ahead of anyone. This way of life is so in harmony with my inner self, that in only six months I've become the number two disciple in the entire commune. And I think I can be number one by June.' Hello! Listen, competition hardly ever leads to serving but often leads to striving! The disciples had started arguing about who would be the greatest in His kingdom. Jesus listened, then He picked up a towel and a basin of water and began to wash their feet. When He finished they were speechless, their hearts exposed, their attitudes corrected. 'Your attitude should be the same as that of Christ Jesus (who) made himself nothing.' Bottom line: serve, don't strive!

content.title: 3 By's
content.introtext:
...the blood...cleanses us from all sin.

1 John 1:7 NKJV
John writes: 'But if we live in the light, as God does, we share in life with each other. And the blood of his Son Jesus washes all our sins away.' He gives us three ways to shine! 1) By living in the light. Live life bright! If you are hiding stuff or hoping your Mum doesn't find out, then you are living in the shadows not the light! 2) By sharing life with each other. Other people can inspire you to reach higher, tell you when you're out of line and help you when stuff is tough. Make sure you have people who are a bit older and a bit wiser who you are 100% honest with and will be 100% honest with you even when you don't what to hear it! 3) By dealing with your sin right away the moment you know you've messed up then make sure you 'fess up. Jesus died to deal with that sin, sort it with God and hold on to the forgiveness He gives you,. Get it sorted then get up and go on with God; don't wallow in self-condemnation. God has put everything in you to blaze brightly in like a star. He's given you friends, family and leaders to draw out the best in you and the blood of Jesus to cleanse your heart. So what's stopping you! LIVE IN THE LIGHT!

content.title: Don't just pray, listen!
content.introtext:
I judge only as I hear....

John 5:30 NIV
Ever wonder why Jesus was always on form and knew what to do? He tells us: Jesus gave them this answer: 'I tell you the truth, the Son can do nothing by himself; he can do only what he sees his Father doing, because whatever the Father does the Son also does. For the Father loves the Son and shows him all he does.' (John 5:19-20 NIV) and 'By myself I can do nothing; I judge only as I hear, and my judgment is just, for I seek not to please myself but him who sent me.' (John 5:30 NIV). Here's the secret, Jesus didn't just talk to His Dad, He took time to listen and get instructions. Your parents might say that you never listen to them and they are chatting away right in your ear; so how do you do when it comes to listening to your heavenly Dad? It's not easy, but when the Bible says, 'Pray without ceasing' (1 Thessalonians 5:17), it means we are to stay in touch with God at all times, to be spiritually sensitive and attuned to the still small voice of His Spirit within us. That calls for having an uncluttered mind and heart. It's easy to tell God what we want but what does He want? God designed the plan for your life; so today, why not get quiet before Him, so that He can tell you about it?

content.title: Get up and run!
content.introtext:
For though a righteous man falls...he rises again...

Proverbs 24:16 NIV
An unfit but determined 40-year-old schoolteacher decided to become a jogger and eventually entered a Marathon; a full 26 miler! It's a gruelling test of heart, mind and body. She knew she wasn't going get an amazing time she just wanted to finish the race; to say she did it! And it wasn't easy! As she ran huge blisters developed on her feet. She was hit and injured by a bicycle. Several miles short of the finish line she was utterly exhausted, yet she kept going. Then within a few hundred yards of her goal, late at night when most other runners had finished or dropped out, she fell and lay flat on her face too tired to get up. But her friends put a bit of tape across the finish line and began to cheer her on. She lifted her head, saw the tape and realised her goal was within sight. With supreme effort she got back up, and with a burst of energy dredged up from deep within her, ran the last few yards.' The Bible talks about what we should focus on when times get tough. Victory belongs to those who keep looking at the goal, not the going; not the process, but the prize; not the trial, but the treasure that's promised to those who persevere. In other words; don't give up and if you fall, take God's hand and get up!

content.title: Learn to make better decisions
content.introtext:
...a prudent man gives thought to his steps.

Proverbs 14:15 NIV
If you're still making the same mistakes you were last year, you need to ask God for wisdom. 'Wise men and women are always learning, always listening for fresh insights' (Proverbs 18:15 TM). Think about it- you are where you are today because of decisions you've made in the past. Both good and bad. If you want to change your future, learn to make better decisions: a) never make permanent decisions based on temporary circumstances. If you do, you'll regret it b) don't let your emotions take over. Pray, weigh things carefully looking at all the fact not just feelings c) surround yourself with People who will tell you the truth; even when you don't want to hear it d) take the time to consider all options. What looks good to you today, may not look so good tomorrow e) consider the consequences of each action. Ask yourself, 'Am I ready to handle this right now?' f) be realistic. If you can't count, don't apply for a job in the finance office. If you can't sing, don't record an album. Focus on what God gifted you to do. That's where you'll succeed g) time is your most limited and valuable resource. Don't waste it h) allow yourself a 10% risk of being wrong, a 50% likelihood of betrayal, and a 100% commitment to trust God, go forward and survive it all.

content.title: Prepared, planted, placed, pruned, prospered (4)
content.introtext:
God planted a garden...there He put the man whom He had formed.

Genesis 2:8 NKJV
Some restaurants and hotels buy plastic plants; you know, a few flowers on a table or a tree in a lobby , and they never need watering or pruning! Yes, plastic plants are hassle free but they're fake; they have no life! God doesn't want your relationship with Him to just LOOK like the real thing, He's not into plastic Christianity, but if you don't want a fake life with God it will take a bit of work. The Bible says: 'God took the man and put him in the Garden of Eden to work it and take care of it' (Genesis 2:15 NIV). Today God may be saying to you, 'I've prepared you, placed you where you need to be, planted blessings in your life that are scheduled to come up at different times, but now you've got to work it.' God may have placed you in a church or group of people; that doesn't mean they won't wind you up. God might have planted opportunities in your life; that doesn't mean making the most of them isn't hard work. No one likes being formed and prepared, especially if that means we have to change! It takes time, but it's worth it. In our comfort obsessed culture we can forget that what is easiest isn't always best. Don't expect God to do things He's expecting you to do- Get to work!

content.title: Prepared, planted, placed, pruned, prospered (3)
content.introtext:
God planted a garden...there He put the man whom He had formed.

Genesis 2:8 NKJV
Do your parents ever watch 'Location Location Location' on Channel 4? In the programme, a woman with frilly blouses and a really tall bloke help people find their perfect home in the perfect location! Notice in the verse, God placed the man in the garden, 'eastward in Eden' (Genesis 2:8 NKJV). It's not enough to be in the garden, you've got to be in the right location. That doesn't have to mean the school you go to or the house you live in (those things might be out of your control) but it might mean what group of mates you hang out with, or if you join the worship team at church, or if sign up for that mission week. God has a plan so ask Him to place you in the locations, relationships and opportunities that are perfect for you. Remember, God doesn't want to dump you, drop you or shove you somewhere, He wants to place you. Ever played chess with someone who spends ages thinking about his or her next move? They pick up the queen slowly place it on a square, keep their finger on for a moment and then finally sit back. It was thought through- it was placed! God knows what He is doing! It's easy to drift into your future but instead go to God, who will place you. If He places you somewhere you know it's in the plan.

content.title: Prepared, planted, placed, pruned, prospered (1)
content.introtext:
...God planted a garden...there He put the man whom He had formed.

Genesis 2:8 NKJV
Before God put Adam into the garden, He 'formed' him. God knows where he wants you (remember yesterday?) and how he wants to use you. Maybe He's told you about it, but now you're frustrated because it's not happening yet. There's a process of preparation God takes us through, but preparation takes time. God must deal with our inconsistencies, personality defects, areas of distrust, and a sackful of other stuff. How long does it take? Only God knows. The Bible says the Lord 'formed man out of the dust of the ground' (Genesis 2:7 NKJV). What is God working with? Dirt! And the tools He uses to form you are the experiences you go through in life. They shape and alter you. And the more you keep trying to have it your way, the longer the process takes. It may take you five years to learn to stop people-pleasing, or ten years to stop feeling sorry for yourself, or twenty years to stop going back and reliving your childhood. All the while God is telling you, 'Stop it,' and you're saying, 'Yeah, I know. I'm gonna do better.' Then finally a crisis happens and the truth hits you. You need to change. At that point you say, 'You know what? I'm going to forget those things which are behind and start reaching for those things which are before' (Philippians 3:13). Why wait?

content.title: It doesn't matter
content.introtext:
IT DOESN'T MATTER. THE IMPORTANT THING IS...THEY ARE PREACHING ABOUT CHRIST. SO I AM HAPPY..

PHILIPPIANS 1:18
Imagine you have a Great Uncle George who owns a corner shop and invites you round. Behind the counter there's row upon row of sweets. As you stand eyes bulging and mouth drooling Great Uncle George says, 'Take what you want!' WHAT? WOW!! All this stuff... for FREE! You fill your pockets with all you can carry! God tells us that He has loads of good things stored in Heaven for us to have FOR FREE! (Deuteronomy 28:12) So nothing matters because, no matter what is going on, God will take care of us and provide for all our needs. Even when our problem is other people! Paul wrote today's Bible verse when he was stuck in prison and some other Christians were causing him hassle, making it worse for him instead of better. Paul knew about all the stuff God has stored in Heaven. He knew it wasn't worth worrying or arguing over. God would sort it! That's why he was able to say...'it doesn't matter'. All God asks is that we do the best we can for Him in whatever situation we're in and rely on Him to take care of the rest! Even taking care of other people. So if you're feeling hassled, annoyed, anxious because of feelings towards other people, go and ask God to fill you full of stuff from His Heavenly warehouse, and then say it doesn't matter!

content.title: Mind Games
content.introtext:
BE CAREFUL WHAT YOU THINK BECAUSE YOUR THOUGHTS RUN YOUR LIFE.

PROVERBS 4:23
Ever thought negative things about your ability, your appearance, your personality, what you have or don't have or about your life as a whole? Ever thought similar negative things about other people? Keep thinking like this and your going to have a pretty negative life, says God! But how can you be careful about what you think though? Thoughts just pop into your head, right? You can't control what you think? Or how often you think it? Perhaps not?! But you can control what you do with them. You can stop them in mid flow: 1) Do the Maths: Each thought you have, ask yourself, 'Does God agree with it?' If He doesn't, think about what God would think instead! Positive thought + agreement with God = keep it. Negative thought + disagreement with God = chuck it. 2) Choose the subject: Keep doing maths and you'll soon learn God's thoughts about a whole loada stuff. You'll be able to recognise a bad thought instantly and can choose to switch the subject before it takes root. Get those bad thoughts in a choke-hold until they give up and submit to Jesus (2 Corinthians 10:5). 3) Don't feel your way: Don't rely on what you feel, go with what you know. We live by what we believe, not by what we can see. (2 Cororinthians 5:7) So, no playing mind games, be careful what you think.

content.title: ENJOY!
content.introtext:
THIS IS THE DAY THAT THE LORD HAS MADE. LET US REJOICE AND BE GLAD TODAY!

Psalm 118:24 (NCV)
Ever watched a kid being made to say sorry when they didn't want to? They say the word....but you so know they don't mean it. Or ever been asked to say 'Thank you' to your Aunty Betty for giving you THAT JUMPER for Christmas? It's so false isn't it? You don't mean it so why say it? Well God doesn't want that sort of relationship with you; where you tell Him stuff but don't mean it. Get this: you're alive because God created you to be here at this moment in time. Everything you're going through, He knows about it; more than that, He's bothered, He's going through it with you and He's never going to leave you, never going to give up on you. He loves you more than you can imagine, He's got your name tattooed on the palm of His hand, never a moment goes by where He's not thinking of you. He loves the sound of your voice, your quirky ways, the way you look, even when you've just got out of bed He thinks you look great! Every time you mess up He'll forgive you, all you have to do is ask. When you hurt, he hurts. He's so into you! All that, and more, is happening EVERY single day! Now isn't that worth being thankful for. Today IS a day to Enjoy.......and by the way, so is tomorrow...and the next day...and the day after that...

content.title: Flying round the light
content.introtext:
EVERYONE IS LOOKING FOR YOU!

MARK 1:37 NIV
Ever watched a moth fly around a light? There's the whole room to fly around in, yet they keep as close as possible to the light! Their focus never moves off the light. They stick to their agenda! God wants you to be that focused on Him! All sorts of stuff will fly by your life, trying to distract you from Jesus. People will throw their opinions at you, trying to get you doing what they think you should be doing. Spend time with God, get to know what you should be doing from Him, and don't do anything different. In Mark 1: 33-34 you can read how, 'The whole town gathered...and Jesus healed many'. As you can imagine, the next morning another crowd of needy people were waiting on His doorstep, but how Jesus responded this time might surprise you. 'While it was still dark, Jesus...left the house and went off to a solitary place, where he prayed...his companions went to look for him, and when they found him they exclaimed: "Everyone is looking for you!" Jesus replied, "Let us go somewhere else...so I can preach there also. That is why I have come"' (vs 35-38). What was He thinking? There were headlines to be made, fans waiting to pat Him on the back! How good would that have been? Not as good as focusing on God's plans. He wants you to do the same.

content.title: Exam Pressure
content.introtext:
THE MAN WHO DOES NOT GIVE UP WHEN TESTS COME IS HAPPY

James 1:12 (NLT)
Even the thought of them can make you feel sick and dizzy, so not many people look forward to that time of year when EXAMS come around. Aaagghh! Ever wish you didn't get stressed? Wouldn't it be great if no matter what was going on you could just handle it; no stress; no pressure; feeling good 100%? Well if Paul learnt how to do just that, so can you! How did he learn it? He sat every single exam that was given to him. In every test of life he clung hold of Jesus and said; 'show me how to get through this God'. He had his fair share of tests to put up with: he was beaten to a pulp, shipwrecked, ridiculed, imprisoned in the type of places that would be illegal today, and even stoned (and we're not talking drugs here, we're talking being pelted with bricks)! He could have thrown in the towel anytime, given up on God, but instead he said, 'I can make it through anything because Jesus gives me strength (Philippians 4:13). Through sticking with Jesus he 'learned to be content whatever the circumstances' (Philippians 4:11) Heaven is cheering you on today so don't give in! When you get knocked down get up again! Be more determined than ever to live for Jesus! And you like Paul will find that stress can be overcome by God's power.

content.title: Where's your head at?
content.introtext:
GOD HAS HANDED YOUR ENEMY OVER TO YOU.

1 SAMUEL 26:8 (NCV)
Ever wanted to 'punch someone's lights out'? Abishai was a bit like that. He was a friend of David, who had a best mate called Jonathan, whose dad was called Saul, who was really jealous of David and wanted to stick a spear through his head (no really!) The whole situation made an episode of Eastenders look like the Teletubbies (check it out in 1 Samuel 18)! A few episodes later (1 Samuel 26) we find David, who'd run for his life, in a situation where if he wanted to, he could stick a spear through Saul's head instead! Revenge! His mate Abishai was well up for it (1 Samuel 26:8), and actually believed that it was what God wanted. But David knew God better. More than wanting to punch Saul's lights out, for treating him so badly, he wanted Saul to know God, so he chose to act God's way. He was more interested in making God known, than making himself known. More willing to trust God to sort out Saul, than do it himself. David was no wimp, he could have taken Saul out, but He chose to do things God's way. Where's your head at? Do you get your fists out or stab at people with pointed words? DON'T DO IT! God says, 'don't insist on getting even, that's not for you...I'll take care of it' (Romans 8:19).

content.title: Power Up
content.introtext:
IF ANYONE BELIEVES IN ME, RIVERS OF LIVING WATER WILL FLOW OUT FROM THAT PERSONS HEART.

John 7:38 (NCV)
You wouldn't expect your telly to work if it wasn't plugged in would you? Or your ipod to work with no battery? And however much you want your mobile phone never to run out of credit, you know that there will come a time when you're going to have to top up! If you don't; the thing's useless, even if you've got the latest all singing all dancing model. Well don't expect to live the Christian life without powering up either! You may look great, but nothing much will happen. Ephesians 5:18 tells us to 'be filled with the Spirit.' God's Holy Spirit is like our spiritual power supply. You need to be filled with Holy Spirit; God's Power, because only then are you going to be able to experience the effects of God in your life. Check out the New Testament for examples of what happens when people are filled with Holy Spirit. AMAZING! When your mobile is topped up and charged up it can do what it was designed to do. When you get topped up and charged up with God Power, you're able to do what you were designed to do, too. What are you waiting for? Get praying for God to fill you with His Holy Spirit, so you can see the effects of God's power flowing in and out of your life.

content.title: HAPPY PILLS
content.introtext:
A CHEERFUL DISPOSITION IS GOOD FOR YOUR HEALTH; GLOOM AND DOOM LEAVE YOU BONE-TIRED.

Proverbs 17:22 (TM)
Ok, you may not want to hear about the film Mary Poppins, but stick with it! One of the scenes involves a visit to Uncle Albert, who floats in the air uncontrollably whenever he laughs. Its infectious and soon everyone ends up floating around singing 'I love to laugh' and having tea on the ceiling. It gives a great picture of what God is saying to us today. Be happy inside, it makes a difference; it gives you a boost that can keep you healthy. Isn't it the best when you have a day where you feel on top of the world, you're confident, you're thinking positive, you even find it easy to be nice to people!? Well God wants you to have more of these days; they're good for you! But it is easier said than done though isn't it? Life is tough sometimes. So is God asking the impossible? Is there a holy happy pill? Well check out Nehemiah 8:10 'Don't feel bad. The joy of God is your strength!' God never asks you to do something without helping you achieve it. The more you get to know God, the more you learn to trust Him and the easier it becomes to be happy inside, no matter what is happening. So what you waiting for? Get into God; knowing Him is better than any sort of happy pill!

content.title: I said 'Stop thinking about it!'
content.introtext:
DO NOT REMEMBER THE THINGS THAT HAVE HAPPENED BEFORE. DO NOT THINK ABOUT THE THINGS OF THE PAST. SEE, I WILL DO A NEW THING.

Isaiah 43: 19-18 (NLT)
Heard of David Beckham? Of course you have. Yet there was a time nobody knew him. He started out as most kids, loving football, dreaming of playing for his country. He played whenever he could and kept on practising. The mistakes he made, didn't stop him from keeping on trying, neither did getting beat! He concentrated on his future, not what he couldn't do or had done wrong. He made his first Premier League appearance for Man United on 2 April 1995, in a 0-0 draw against Leeds United. It could have been all over for Beckham then, except he had a pretty cool manager, Alex Ferguson, who choose to do something new. Instead of buying star players when experienced players left, he let the youth players replace them. He was criticised for it...especially when the season started with a 3-1 defeat! But Alex saw the potential in these young guys, he saw their hard work, dedication and determination. He did something new, so they could have a chance to fulfil their dreams. For Beckham... the rest, as we say, is History. Imagine if had a manager like that, who'd take a risk on you so you could fulfil your dreams! Well guess what? U DO!!! God is the best manager you could ever have. He sees your potential and wants to unlock it! So get out there; God wants you on his team!

content.title: Look forwards not backwards
content.introtext:
BUT FORGET ALL THAT, IT IS NOTHING COMPARED TO WHAT I AM GOING TO DO. FOR I AM ABOUT TO DO SOMETHING NEW.

Isaiah 43 :18-19 (NLT)
Has someone stopped you doing something because you messed up the last time? Ever felt like you missed out on something because you weren't trusted? Have you stopped chasing after your dream because you've told yourself you're not good enough, or talented enough? We all make mistakes and it's easy to turn these mistakes into doubting our own ability, especially when other people doubt our ability too. Gods not like that. When He looks at us, all He sees is what we can be; not all that we have been. He wants us to see the same. God doesn't want you to live thinking about all the stuff that's gone wrong. Have you ever walked into something because you weren't looking where you were going? You feel stupid don't you... and get hurt! It's not the best or safest way to walk is it? That's why God asks us to live our lives looking where we're going, looking at what He is doing. Check out the future God planned for these guys, who chose to look ahead to what God could do with their life: Rahab, a prostitute saves her family from death, (Joshua 6:25); Joseph,a shepherd boy, saves thousands from starvation (Genesis 41:54); Deborah wins a war and brings peace in Israel for 40 years (Judges 5:31). Look forwards not backwards and see what God will do with your life.

content.title: Down but not out.
content.introtext:
WE ARE PRESSED...BUT NOT...BROKEN.

2 CORINTHIANS 4:8 TLB
Do you ever feel like your head's mashed? You've got yourself in a situation that's stickier than a jam butty? You're stuck in a room with a hundred doors but none of them will open? Don't stress about it; God's got it sorted. You're mates with the Man of miracles. You may feel like everyone's out to get you, but God's never going to abandon you. It's when you're under pressure that your faith really shines through; and God knows just how much pressure you can deal with. He lets us get to the stage when a) we've tried all our own ways, and realise maybe we don't always know what's best b) we're fed up of satan nicking everything that God says is ours c) we don't let other people's thoughts and opinions control us. At that point, we're ready to give God permission to take control and sort us out. Faith shows its real power when there are no options left; Joshua wouldn't have needed God to split a river in half if there were bridges all around, would he? So often, it's only when there's nothing obvious we can do that we start trusting God to do the impossible. Why not shake up your faith today and trusting Him in everything? You may feel under pressure, but with God on your side, you'll get stronger every day.

content.title: Don't be a chocoholic!
content.introtext:
YOU MUST NOT GIVE SIN A VOTE.

ROMANS 6:12 TM
Have you ever stuffed yourself on a Maccy D's 'til you're so full you're gonna explode? Or Christmas dinner; you couldn't eat another mouthful until someone opens a tin of Quality Street, and you just can't stop yourself. One won't hurt. You know you don't need it, but you have one anyway; then another... and another... and then you start on your selection box! Before you know it, you're feeling really ill. You know it's bad for you but you can't stop yourself; it's addictive. Sin is a bit like that, you know when something's wrong, when it's bad for you. But just like those chocolates, what might not seem too bad to start with is addictive, and once you start, it's hard to stop. The Bible says don't even go there! Your old way of life was nailed to the cross with Jesus; that means your sin too. When Jesus died, He took sin down with Him. Alive, He brings God to us. Do you get it? With God on your side, you can resist the temptation. So, throw yourself at doing things God's way. Remember, sin isn't inevitable for us anymore; Jesus has sent us His Spirit to help us every day, the same Spirit that raised from the dead (Ephesians 1:19-20). So come on; don't be a chocoholic. Turn your back on that stuff, you've got God on your side.

content.title: The'Church of Adullam' (2) -Bad hair day!
content.introtext:
ADULLAM...WHERE...ALL WHO WERE DOWN ON THEIR LUCK CAME.

1 SAMUEL 22:1-2 TM
Have you ever had one of those days? Nothing's going right, you woke up with crazy hair and a huge zit on your chin, you've just been dumped, you're skint and you've get shed-loads of dull, dull, dull homework to do, when you were supposed to be going out. You've just had enough. You're fed up. You feel like life is pointless. It's times like that, when everything's pants, that it would be really easy just to run away, wallow in a big soggy bog of self pity, put on your most depressing CD and sit in the dark until it's all over. But there's something else you could do instead. God is there watching everything you're going through, just waiting to help you through it. Shelter in God and do what David did, make that cave a place of getting to know God better. If you're stuck for words, then why not start like David did? 'Be good to me, God; and now! I've run to you for dear life. I'm hiding out under Your wings until the hurricane blows over. He sends orders from heaven and saves me, he humiliates those who kick me around' (Psalm 57:1-3 TM). Are you feeling down on your luck today? Do you see yourself as damaged goods? Instead of wandering alone in the wilderness, come in and find what you need in God's presence.

content.title: The 'Church of Adullam'(1) -Odd ones out?
content.introtext:
ADULLAM...WHERE...ALL WHO WERE DOWN ON THEIR LUCK CAME.

1 SAMUEL 22:1-2 TM
Ever felt like you don't fit in? Everything around you is falling apart? No-one wants to know? David knew just how you feel. Things got so bad for him, he was completely abandoned and ended up living in the wilderness. When life's tough you may well feel like that but have hope; it doesn't end there. God won't leave you to swelter in the heat; He'll send help if you ask, but it may not come in the way you expect... When David was at rock bottom, he went and hid out in a cave called 'Adullam'.
